definition: indecisive/wavering
surname Yao
to shake/to rock/to row/to crank
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
(negative prefix)/not/no
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: He vacillates from agile, amiable, and arch to repetitive and awkward.
sentences.chinese: 他搖擺不定的敏捷，和藹可親，並拱重複和尷尬。

sentences.english: Doubts about this eternal truth come because of the wavering Mind.
sentences.chinese: 對此永恆真理會產生懷疑是因爲心念搖擺不定。

sentences.english: The staggering totals indicate why McGrady needed to get to the hoop.
sentences.chinese: 搖擺不定的數據表明了爲什麼麥迪需要更靠近籃圈。

sentences.english: Mr Samaras, as opposition leader, has taken an equivocal position.
sentences.chinese: 作爲反對派領袖，薩馬拉斯的立場搖擺不定。

sentences.english: My emotions continued to seesaw between pleasure and embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 我的心情也依然在高興與不自在之間搖擺不定。

sentences.english: He constantly wavers in his feelings toward her.
sentences.chinese: 他不斷地搖擺不定，他對她的感情。

sentences.english: Between these two images she wavered, hesitating which to believe.
sentences.chinese: 她在這兩個影象之間搖擺不定，不知道該相信哪個好。

sentences.english: These elements will turn Vietnam into a "two-faced" nation.
sentences.chinese: 這些元素會使越南轉變成一個搖擺不定的國家。

sentences.english: "Tergiversate" is Word of The Year 2011 according to Dictionary. com.
sentences.chinese: “搖擺不定”當選爲“字典網”的2011年度熱詞。

sentences.english: The president vowed to rally Americans and wavering lawmakers alike.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬誓言團結美國民衆和搖擺不定的國會議員。

sentences.english: Police said his eyes were glassy, his speech thick and his walk unsure.
sentences.chinese: 警方說他的目光迷離，說話聲音嘶啞，走路搖擺不定。

sentences.english: They stagger from liquor, They reel in their visions, They totter in their judgments.
sentences.chinese: 他們見異象時搖搖晃晃，行審判時搖擺不定。

sentences.english: China's energy-intensity data are as wobbly as other indicators.
sentences.chinese: 中國的能源消耗數據如同其他指數一樣搖擺不定。

sentences.english: Korea's relations with American have long seesawed between peace and peril.
sentences.chinese: 南韓和美國的關係在和平與緊張中長期搖擺不定。
搖擺不定的美國對外政策。

definition: to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
unification and independence
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
spilt water is difficult to retrieve (idiom)/it's no use crying over spilt milk/what's done is done and can't be reversed/the damage is done/once divorced, there's no reuniting
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
to submit to the will of heaven/to resign oneself to fate/to trust to luck
to define
specious arguments/sophistry
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to boss people around (idiom)
to gesticulate while talking (idiom)/to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily
to judge
docile and obedient/all obedience
to work to no avail (idiom)
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
